posts.name: jimfl014
posts.cooked:
Our Pigeon 2 shows up in the tuner as version 22.6.1.0.  Both lights are alternating yellow.

The DS has repeated errors

Error -3 CTR:  CAN Fram not received/too stale.  Pigeon IMU 1 Get Yaw Pitch Roll Error -3 CTR:  CAN Fram not received/too stale.  Pigeon IMU 1GetYawPitchRoll Error 103 CTR: Firm Version could not be retrieved.  Use Phoenix Tuner to check ID and Firmware…

Swerve.java (3.9 KB)

posts.name: Gavin Matthews
posts.cooked:
Looks like I’m too slow, but here’s what I was in the middle of writing.

Pigeon 2 status lights are documented here . image 638×511 62.7 KB

image 638×511 62.7 KB

image 638×511 62.7 KB

Looking at the Firmware link here , it looks like the latest version for 2022 was 22.6.2.2 , and there is a 2023 version available 22.99.22.2-Pro-alpha (edit: but you may not want to use that).

What was the code issue?

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked:
bovlb:

a 2023 version available 22.99.22.2-Pro-alpha .

I wouldn’t use this one at all currently- it likely requires both a 2023 beta roborio image and a phoenix pro license

posts.name: JamesCH95
posts.cooked: What was your code issue? We are seeing the same thing.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: Likely using the PigeonIMU class instead of the Pigeon2 class

posts.name: jimfl014
posts.cooked:
I honestly do not remember it was that far back, other than we resolved it as a simple coding issue.  It might have been we were using the wrong class.

I will ask the kids today if they remember
